alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northeastern Nye County; Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Northwestern Nye County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County; White Pine County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 1:40AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Colder and wetter conditions are expected for the upcoming weekend... Dry and mild conditions will continue for the latter portions of the week as highs reach into the 70s. An incoming storm system will bring increasing winds on Friday and Saturday. In addition, precipitation chances will increase as the system draws near. By late Friday night through Saturday, a strong cold front will move through the area bringing much colder temperatures. The majority of the precipitation is expected to be rain in the valleys, though some higher passes and summits could see an inch or two of measurable snowfall. Travel hazards due to slick and slushy conditions are possible along the aforementioned summits and passes. Please go to www.nvroads.com to keep updated on road conditions if planning to drive during the Saturday to Sunday timeframe. It will be much colder on Sunday as morning lows will be in the 20s and highs will struggle to reach 50 degrees, with many locations staying in the 40s. Visit www.weather.gov/elko for the latest weather information.
